result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Theodore Hartwig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for payment of atty. fees for $985.96

Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in court with attorney Joseph L Viney and Maura Melka.  Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances.  Matters are all resolved along w/2 Columbia Co cases.  14CF134 includes information Col Co cases.  State states recs.  DE attorney's waive prelims in 15CF134, 14CF289 and 14CF52.  Court questions DE on prelim waivers/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Court reviews application for consolidation and approves that.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts.  Court addresses arraignment on 14CF432.  Attorney Melka acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands by her previous NC pleas.  Atty Viney does the same.  Court advises DE of all charges/max penalties.  NC pleas accepted and Court dismisses/reads-in all agreed charges.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement.  Atty's Viney and Melka make statements.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Jail credit is yet to be determined in writing.  

Columbia Co cases 14CF162 and 14CF218 consolidated...14CF162 is on information for Sauk Co case 15CF134

14CF52
Ct 1:  NC
Probation for 5 years
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid per agent during term of probation
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Counseling and any other treatment/evaluations per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment/education or combination thereof per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Ct 4:  NC - amended to Op. w/RCS - 3rd
45 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence (1st 48 hrs consecutive)
$1694.00 fine/costs and $25.00 blood draw fee to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
Revoke DL 24 mos/IID 24 mos effective upon licensure
AODA

Probation per 14CF52 Ct 1
Ct 4:  NC
$443.00 costs to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

AODA/treatment per agent

$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states appearances.  Atty Melka appears for initial appearance in 15CM21, acknowledges rec. complaint, waives reading and stands mute.  Believes there will be a global resolution.  Reset in Br 2 already on 5/2/2015 at 3pm.  Bonds continued.  All matters to track.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
for leave to file additional motions
Return date on March 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE states he applied for PD appt last week but hasn't heard back yet.  He does have another case where he does have counsel.  Court resets to 3/5/2015 at 1pm.  Advises DE to go to PD's office right after court today.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Return date on March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Theodore Hartwig in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney, waived. DE states has atty. Viney, not retained yet.   File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $100.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
